author: William Wordsworth
poem_title: The Column Intended by Buonaparte for a Triumphal Edifice in Milan, now Lying by the Wayside on the Semplon
print_collection_title: Memorials of a Tour on the Continent
print_publisher: Longman, Hurst, Rees, Orme, and Brown
notes_on_composition: Wordsworth wrote this collection of poems during an 1820 tour of Europe.

author: Felicia Hemans
notes_on_composition: Poems in Hemans' 1808 volume were composed between ages 8 and 13, ranging from around 1800 to first publication in 1808.

author: John Clare
notes_on_composition: Edmund Blunden and Alan Porter, editors of the 1920 collection of Clare's poems, place the poem in a collection of Clare's "Middle Period" manuscripts dated 1824 to 1836.

author: Anna Laetitia Barbauld
print_collection_title: The Works of Anna Laetitia Barbauld
print_publisher: Longman, Hurst, Rees, Orme, Brown, and Green
notes_on_composition: Poems are arranged chronologically by Aikin. Written on a Marble appears after works in Barbauld's 1773 collection Poems and before her 1791 poem Epistle to William Wilberforce on the Rejection of the Bill for Abolishing the Slave Trade.

author: Percy Bysshe Shelley
print_collection_subtitle: A Modern Ecologue; with Other Poems
notes_on_composition: Manuscript dated 1817. Minor differences in word choice exist between manuscript and 1819 printed edition.
